Header: India tax evasion amnesty uncovers hidden billions
Content: A tax evasion amnesty in India has prompted tens of thousands of people to declare more than $9.5bn in undeclared income and assets. Finance minister Arun Jaitley said the four-month window that ended on Friday brought in 64,275 declarations. All were offered immunity from prosecution in return for paying tax, a surcharge and a penalty. It is estimated that the government could raise nearly $4.5bn from the scheme. Undeclared income or "black money" is a huge issue in India.
